name: Sukantara Cascade Resort & Spa

reviews.text: The Luxury Camp was an amazing experience which exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Luxury Camp

likes.liked: — Luxury Camp - modern appliances in nature

reviews.text: The relaxed atmosphere was really comfortable, fitted with modern appliances, hot water an in ground spa bath and bamboo shower - pure luxury in Northern Thailand! If you are looking for modern comfort in a relaxed atmosphere with stunning waterfall views, visit Sukantara and stay in the luxury camp - it is an experience to remember!
reviews.title: A Perfect Selection

reviews.text: Australia
reviews.title: The most beautiful place in Thailand

likes.liked: — The location and relaxation and staff

reviews.text: We chose Sukantara after speaking directly with the hotel owner, reviewing the web site and reading reviews. I was traveling with my wife and parents for two weeks around Thailand and the 4 days we stayed at Sukantara were the best days by far of the wonderful vacation.
reviews.title: Spectacular, private setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The setting is out of a movie and the staff makes sure your stay is undisturbed, as you get acquainted with the beauty of your surroundings. The food was so fresh and tasteful; better yet, it was so reasonably priced for the quality. Each one of us experienced a spa treatment and it was so incredibly tranquil and restorative.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — The lush exotic plants/greenery @ ur fingertips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sukantara is a Must that is have to try once in your life...Landscape,people and food are fantastic and you feel like in another dimesion so faraway from our western way of life.
reviews.title: AMAZING...

reviews.text: I would like to thanks all the staff and especially Sam you give us a dream.
reviews.title: Gem in the forest

reviews.text: Thank you...
reviews.title: A tropical paradise with mixed feelings

reviews.text: With love,
reviews.title: The second we walked in, we didn't want to leave.

reviews.text: Andrea & Rossella
reviews.title: Stunning Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sounds as though I've contradicted myself re location! It's in the middle of the most beautiful waterfall and woodland but you and are 9km from the nearest form of civilisation. The location relative to everything else is miles away yet we were led to believe it was just outside Chiang Mai. It will costs you at least a 900Baht round trip, if there's anyone there to take you and we were told it would be an hour's wait. if you want to go out to eat in Chiang Mai, it's 30km away - we rented a scooter but is still cost us 1,600 Baht to get to the rental shop. The food in the resort restaurant was awful and they are obviously abusing their monopoly. Our tent was stunning once inside but all the wood it's been built on is rotting away so we had to be very careful not to fall through it - it's only been built for 5 years so you'd have thought they'd have treated the wood properly. It was the most expensive place we have ever booked in Thailand and we'd have had better service and food in a guest house, as we did in other parts of Thailand. Frustratingly, every time we spoke to someone, their stock answer was "ok, yes" Admittedly, we're not fluent in Thai but, if they are boasting a 5 star resort, some form of communication would have been good.
reviews.title: 5 star location but appalling quality service

reviews.text: A marvelous place to visit. Beutiful scenery. I spent 4days and will surely visit this place again. If u need a peaceful and relaxation place to stay this is the best place to visit. In addition, the 3 peacocks at the resort are beautiful.
reviews.title: A hidden Gem and a paradise on earth.

reviews.text: Property:
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: Breathtaking, out-door scenery that one would only see on a post card.
reviews.title: Lovely place that I could say which I can touch the real of natural, water fall, forest near by the town, about 30 KMs
Relaxing in Nature in comfort with GREAT food
reviews.text: Location:

We didn't stay there but went for dinner as I saw from the website how beautiful it is. The review also didn't confer confidence. Also, it was pretty expensive. But I am a sucker for cascades and waterfalls. We were the only diner. Perhaps even the the only guests in the resort! Therefore, they were very kind to give us the very best table - right on the rock platform next to the cascase. The rushing water was a mere 4 feet away! The cascade was beautifully lighted up. The sound of the rushing water hypnotizing... We just sat quietly enjoying the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Heavenly Location!

reviews.text: Food was surprisingly pretty tasty. Our party of 3 included 2 Thais and a foreigner. Even my Thai friend commented that it was OK. After reading the reviews I expected pretty bad food, which we were prepared for since we were there more for the scenery. We had Thai Lard Nha, crispy and good prawn spring rolls and a couple of Thai salads. Portion was small though and the cost on a high side.
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.text: After dinner we checked out the Deluxe Cottage closest to the restaurant. It was very nice - Luxurious, cosy and spacious. We didn't see any maintenance issue. Everything looked well maintained. Only thing was the room smelled of mildew. Perhaps due to irregular usage.
reviews.title: Past it's prime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only regret is we arrived too late and it was already dark. I knew that they light up the cascade. Thus, chose this resort for our dinner. But once we arrived we wished that we got there while it was still bright since it would have been even more beautiful. Or at least beautiful in a different way.
reviews.title: Lovely garden setting but this hotel is no where near a 5 star. Overpriced!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sukantara is a place to recommend - given you want something out of town and on the hillside. It's a beautiful area with opportunities to exploit. Make sure that you book a driver to your trips.
reviews.title: Trapped in paradise

description: Natural Luxury boutique resort which is the perfect for private romantic honeymoon. The Resort lies on the sloping bank of a mountain stream in the verdant Chiangmai highland. Mountain water cascades over boulders in the stream, creating tiered waterfalls right below the Lanna-Balinese-style guest cottages and offers the blissful experiences of close-to-nature living, that will remain a cherished memory for a lifetime.
